Key Match Events: Andy Balbirnie scored 62 runs (47 balls) for Ireland
Josh Little took 2 wickets for Ireland (16 runs in 3 overs)
Mark Wood took 3 wickets for England (34 runs in 4 overs)
Dawid Malan scored 35 runs (37 balls, 2 fours, 66m) for England
Josh Little was the star with the ball early on, unplayable with late swing and seam movement
Moeen Ali scored 24 runs (12 balls) not out for England
Post-Match Reflections: Andy Balbirnie said, 'It's amazing, kind of emotional. To come here against tournament favourites here at the MCG, where we have never played a game before, is amazing.'
Jos Buttler, England Captain, said, 'I thought we were poor in the first 10 overs and let them get away. We were not consistent enough, let them score on both sides of the wicket.'
Josh Little was the star with the ball early on, unplayable with late swing and seam movement
Adair assisted Josh Little and beat the bat often
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, leading to a delay and eventual call off
Ireland's win is described as historic, reminiscent of their famous 2011 50-over World Cup win
Fortune favoured Ireland at the end as England were finally getting close to par after being well behind for pretty much all of the innings
The next game between Afghanistan and New Zealand is on the same ground, with a quick turnaround for Ireland
